PLAY.TITLE: The Tragedy of Coriolanus

PERSONAE.TITLE: Dramatis Personae
PERSONAE.PERSONA: CAIUS MARCIUS, Afterwards CAIUS MARCIUS CORIOLANUS.
TULLUS AUFIDIUS, general of the Volscians.
Roman and Volscian Senators, Patricians, Aediles, Lictors, Soldiers, Citizens, Messengers, Servants to Aufidius, and other Attendants.

PLAY.SCNDESCR: SCENE Rome and the neighbourhood; Corioli and the neighbourhood; Antium.

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Rome. A street.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter a company of mutinous Citizens, with staves,
clubs, and other weapons

Enter COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators;
JUNIUS BRUTUS and SICINIUS VELUTUS

Citizens steal away. Exeunt all but SICINIUS
and BRUTUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Corioli. The Senate-house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS and certain Senators

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. Rome. A room in Marcius' house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter VOLUMNIA and VIRGILIA they set them down
on two low stools, and sew
Enter VALERIA, with an Usher and Gentlewoman

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Before Corioli.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter, with drum and colours, MARCIUS, TITUS
LARTIUS, Captains and Soldiers. To them a
Messenger

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARCIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
They sound a parley. Enter two Senators with others
on the walls

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter the army of the Volsces

Alarum. The Romans are beat back to their
trenches. Re-enter MARCIUS cursing

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARCIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Another alarum. The Volsces fly, and MARCIUS
follows them to the gates

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Re-enter MARCIUS, bleeding, assaulted by the enemy
They fight, and all enter the city

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. Corioli. A street.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter MARCIUS and TITUS LARTIUS with a trumpet

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Near the camp of Cominius.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter COMINIUS, as it were in retire,
with soldiers

SPEECH.SPEAKER: MARCIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
They all shout and wave their swords, take him up in
their arms, and cast up their caps

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VII. The gates of Corioli.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
TITUS LARTIUS, having set a guard upon
Corioli, going with drum and trumpet toward
COMINIUS and CAIUS MARCIUS, enters with
Lieutenant, other Soldiers, and a Scout

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VIII. A field of battle.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Alarum as in battle. Enter, from opposite sides,
MARCIUS and AUFIDIUS

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AUFIDIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
They fight, and certain Volsces come to the aid of
AUFIDIUS. MARCIUS fights till they be driven in
breathless

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IX. The Roman camp.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Flourish. Alarum. A retreat is sounded. Flourish.
Enter, from one side, COMINIUS with the Romans; from
the other side, MARCIUS, with his arm in a scarf

Enter TITUS LARTIUS, with his power,
from the pursuit

A long flourish. They all cry 'Marcius! Marcius!'
cast up their caps and lances: COMINIUS and LARTIUS
stand bare

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE X. The camp of the Volsces.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
A flourish. Cornets. Enter TULLUS AUFIDIUS,
bloody, with two or three Soldiers

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Rome. A public place.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter MENENIUS with the two Tribunes of the people,
SICINIUS and BRUTUS.

A sennet. Trumpets sound. Enter COMINIUS the
general, and TITUS LARTIUS; between them, CORIOLANUS,
crowned with an oaken garland; with Captains and
Soldiers, and a Herald

Flourish. Cornets. Exeunt in state, as before.
BRUTUS and SICINIUS come forward

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. The Capitol.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter two Officers, to lay cushions

A sennet. Enter, with actors before them, COMINIUS
the consul, MENENIUS, CORIOLANUS, Senators,
SICINIUS and BRUTUS. The Senators take their
places; the Tribunes take their Places by
themselves. CORIOLANUS stands

Flourish of cornets. Exeunt all but SICINIUS
and BRUTUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. The same. The Forum.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Third Citizen
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Enter CORIOLANUS in a gown of humility, with MENENIUS

SCENE.STAGEDIR: Re-enter MENENIUS, with BRUTUS and SICINIUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Rome. A street.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Cornets. Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, all the
Gentry, COMINIUS, TITUS LARTIUS, and other Senators

Enter a rabble of Citizens (Plebeians), with
the AEdiles

SPEECH.STAGEDIR: They all bustle about CORIOLANUS, crying

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
In this mutiny, the Tribunes, the AEdiles, and the
People, are beat in
Re-enter BRUTUS and SICINIUS, with the rabble

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. A room in CORIOLANUS'S house.
SCENE III. The same. The Forum.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CORIOLANUS, MENENIUS, and COMINIUS,
with Senators and Patricians

Exeunt CORIOLANUS, COMINIUS, MENENIUS, Senators,
and Patricians
Shouting, and throwing up their caps

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE I. Rome. Before a gate of the city.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CORIOLANUS, VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA, MENENIUS,
COMINIUS, with the young Nobility of Rome

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. The same. A street near the gate.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter SICINIUS, BRUTUS, and an AEdile

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE III. A highway between Rome and Antium.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter a Roman and a Volsce, meeting

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Antium. Before Aufidius's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter CORIOLANUS in mean apparel, disguised
and muffled

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. The same. A hall in Aufidius's house.
SCENE.STAGEDIR: Enter a third Servingman. The first meets him
Beats him away. Exit third Servingman
Enter AUFIDIUS with the second Servingman

Exeunt CORIOLANUS and AUFIDIUS. The two
Servingmen come forward

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Rome. A public place.
SCENE VII. A camp, at a small distance from Rome.
SCENE I. Rome. A public place.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter MENENIUS, COMINIUS, SICINIUS, BRUTUS,
and others

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE II. Entrance of the Volscian camp before Rome. Two Sentinels on guard.
SCENE III. The tent of Coriolanus.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: CORIOLANUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR:
Enter in mourning habits, VIRGILIA, VOLUMNIA,
leading young MARCIUS, VALERIA, and Attendants

SCENE.STAGEDIR: He holds her by the hand, silent
The Ladies make signs to CORIOLANUS

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE IV. Rome. A public place.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: Second Messenger
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Trumpets; hautboys; drums beat; all together

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE V. The same. A street near the gate.
SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Enter two Senators with VOLUMNIA, VIRGILIA,
VALERIA, & c. passing over the stage,
followed by Patricians and others
A flourish with drums and trumpets. Exeunt

SCENE.TITLE: SCENE VI. Antium. A public place.

SPEECH.SPEAKER: AUFIDIUS
SPEECH.STAGEDIR: Enter three or four Conspirators of AUFIDIUS' faction

SCENE.STAGEDIR:
Drums and trumpets sound, with great shouts of
the People
Enter the Lords of the city

Enter CORIOLANUS, marching with drum and
colours; commoners being with him

The Conspirators draw, and kill CORIOLANUS:
AUFIDIUS stands on his body

Exeunt, bearing the body of CORIOLANUS. A dead
march sounded
